meaningMnemonic: This word consists of kanji with hiragana attached. Because the hiragana ends with an う sound, you know this word is a verb. The kanji itself means <kanji>pour</kanji> so the verb vocab version is <vocabulary>to pour</vocabulary>.
readingMnemonic:
Since this word consists of a kanji with hiragana attached, you can bet that it will use the kun'yomi reading. You didn't learn that reading with this kanji, so here's a mnemonic to help you: 

You are going <vocabulary>to pour</vocabulary> some <reading>sauce</reading> (そそ).
